title: "Because I Built It"(person of Interest)(1 x 22)
author: Person of Interest Highlights
comment: everytime finch says i built it i get goosebumps

It is so brilliant how the color of the box around Peck change from white to yellow the moment Harold tells him about The Machine. My absolute, all time, favorite tv show, it is so intelligent and beautiful. I like POI more than Westworld and I wished that it could've gotten the same amount of attention as Westworld has.

It's fascinating to consider this scene from Peck's point of view.  A strange man, who's he never seen before, sits down, tells him the secrets of the world, and tells him to stop looking.  And it's only at the end, as the man is leaving, that he learns this man is the architect behind the new world.  And then he vanishes.

"But believe me, Mr. Peck, this is a mystery you do not want to solve. Knowing the answer has cost me something I value more than my own life."
That line was delivered so well. Even though Finch may not have looked particularly trustworthy to Peck, there is an undeniable weight to that line such that Peck just has to take the man at his word.
our favorite show predicted Edward Snowden an year earlier
